parameters.query:
SELECT *
FROM accounts
WHERE username = '{{ $json.body.username }}'
  AND type = '{{ $json.body.type }}'
LIMIT 1;

parameters.command:
=bash -eu <<'BASH'
# ===== CONFIG =====
DIR="{{ $('dir').item.json.dir_obj }}"    # main folder
PROCDIR="$DIR/processed"                      # processed/ (locked files live here)
EXT="jpg|png|mp4"                             # allowed extensions (regex, e.g. "jpg|png|mp4")
# ===================

mkdir -p "$DIR" "$PROCDIR"

# helper to list matching files (top-level only), returns null-separated array
list_files() {
  local arr
  # Use posix-extended regex type for clearer grouping
  mapfile -d '' -t arr < <(find "$DIR" -maxdepth 1 -type f -regextype posix-extended -iregex ".*\.($EXT)$" -print0)
  printf "%s\n" "${arr[@]-}"
}

# helper to list processed files
list_processed() {
  local p_arr
  mapfile -d '' -t p_arr < <(find "$PROCDIR" -maxdepth 1 -type f -print0)
  printf "%s\n" "${p_arr[@]-}"
}

# 1) If no files in DIR matching EXT, move everything from processed back to DIR (reset)
mapfile -d '' -t all < <(find "$DIR" -maxdepth 1 -type f -regextype posix-extended -iregex ".*\.($EXT)$" -print0)
if [ ${#all[@]} -eq 0 ]; then
  # check processed folder
  shopt -s nullglob
  files=( "$PROCDIR"/* )
  if [ ${#files[@]} -gt 0 ]; then
    for f in "${files[@]}"; do
      # move back; if any mv fails, report and exit non-zero
      mv -- "$f" "$DIR/" || { echo "__RESET_PARTIAL_FAIL__:$(basename "$f")"; exit 2; }
    done
    # refresh list after reset
    mapfile -d '' -t all < <(find "$DIR" -maxdepth 1 -type f -regextype posix-extended -iregex ".*\.($EXT)$" -print0)
    echo "RESET_DONE"
    # continue to picking below (we intentionally do not exit)
  else
    # nothing anywhere
    echo "__NO_FILES_ANYWHERE__"
    exit 0
  fi
fi

# At this point 'all' should contain candidate files in DIR
if [ ${#all[@]} -eq 0 ]; then
  # defensive - if still empty after attempted reset
  echo "__NO_FILES_AFTER_RESET__"
  exit 0
fi

# 2) pick a random file
if command -v shuf >/dev/null 2>&1; then
  selected="$(printf "%s\n" "${all[@]}" | shuf -n1)"
else
  idx=$(( RANDOM % ${#all[@]} ))
  selected="${all[$idx]}"
fi

filename="$(basename -- "$selected")"
srcpath="$selected"
lockpath="$PROCDIR/$filename"

# 3) atomic move to processed (acts as a lock). If mv fails -> race/perm error
if ! mv -- "$srcpath" "$lockpath"; then
  echo "__MV_FAILED__:$filename"
  exit 2
fi

# 4) ensure rollback on any processing error â€” move file back to DIR
rollback() {
  if [ -e "$lockpath" ]; then
    mv -- "$lockpath" "$DIR/" || echo "__ROLLBACK_FAILED__:$filename"
  fi
}
trap 'rollback; exit 2' ERR

# ====== YOUR PROCESSING COMMANDS START HERE ======
# Replace the example below with your real commands (ffmpeg, convert, upload, etc.)
# Example placeholders:
#  - For video (mp4): ffmpeg -y -i "$lockpath" -vf "scale=1280:-1" "/home/node/shared/YOUTUBE/output/${filename%.*}_resized.mp4"
#  - For image (jpg/png): convert "$lockpath" -resize 1080x1080 "/home/node/shared/YOUTUBE/output/${filename%.*}_thumb.jpg"

# ---- BEGIN PROCESS (REPLACE THIS BLOCK) ----
# Simulate processing; replace 'true' with your commands.
# If any command returns non-zero, trap will run rollback and exit non-zero.
true
# ---- END PROCESS (REPLACE THIS BLOCK) ----
# ===============================================

# on success, remove trap and report OK
trap - ERR
echo "$filename"
exit 0
BASH

    mv -- "$lockpath" "$DIR/" || echo "__ROLLBACK_FAILED__:$filename"
  fi
}
trap 'rollback; exit 2' ERR

# ====== YOUR PROCESSING COMMANDS START HERE ======
# Replace the example below with your real commands (ffmpeg, convert, upload, etc.)
# Example placeholders:
#  - For video (mp4): ffmpeg -y -i "$lockpath" -vf "scale=1280:-1" "/home/node/shared/YOUTUBE/output/${filename%.*}_resized.mp4"
#  - For image (jpg/png): convert "$lockpath" -resize 1080x1080 "/home/node/shared/YOUTUBE/output/${filename%.*}_thumb.jpg"

# ---- BEGIN PROCESS (REPLACE THIS BLOCK) ----
# Simulate processing; replace 'true' with your commands.
# If any command returns non-zero, trap will run rollback and exit non-zero.
true
# ---- END PROCESS (REPLACE THIS BLOCK) ----
# ===============================================

# on success, remove trap and report OK
trap - ERR
echo "$filename"
exit 0
BASH

=cd /home/node/shared/python/pendulum && python3 generate.py --object "{{ $('dir').item.json.dir_obj }}/processed/{{ $('Random_objects1').item.json.stdout }}" --background assets/bg.mp4 --shape "{{ (() => { const s = ['triangle','square','pentagon','hexagon','heptagon','octagon','nonagon','decagon','circle','star','diamond']; return s[Math.floor(Math.random()*s.length)]; })() }}" --output "/home/node/shared/files/output/{{ $('Random_videos1').item.json.stdout }}"

nodes.name: pendulum
nodes.notes:
cd /home/node/shared/python/pendulum && python3 generate.py --object "/home/node/shared/files/icons/processed/{{ $('Random_objects1').item.json.stdout }}" --background assets/bg.mp4 --shape "{{ (() => { const s = ['triangle','square','pentagon','hexagon','heptagon','octagon','nonagon','decagon','circle','star','diamond']; return s[Math.floor(Math.random()*s.length)]; })() }}" --output "/home/node/shared/files/icons/output/puzzle2.mp4" --dim-amount 0.8
